lead_paragraph: Funny Cide, the 2003 Kentucky Derby and Preakness winner, was retired yesterday, nine days after winning the $100,000 Wadsworth Memorial at Finger Lakes. Jack Knowlton, of Sackatoga Stable, the group that owns the horse, said Funny Cide was healthy.“He came in a winner and goes out a winner and he accomplished a lot in between,” Knowlton said. “We want to give him an opportunity to enjoy his retirement.”.
